title: The Duchess of Cambridge reveals Princess Charlotte’s unusual favourite foods
text:
Cape Town - While tots her age love tucking into chocolates, sweets, and biscuits, Britain’s Princess Charlotte seems to prefer the opposite.

With quite a few skilled chefs readily available to cater to their every need, it should come as no surprise that the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge’s daughter is developing a varied taste in food.

Earlier this year while visiting the Lavender Primary School in Enfield, England, to support children’s mental health week, Kate (37) mentioned that her little girl enjoys olives, Express UK reported.

“Charlotte loves olives,” said the mother of three to the school children.

While visiting the Aga Khan Centre in London earlier this month, Kate revealed the four-year-old has quite a taste for fiery curry, DailyMail reported.

"It’s so hard cooking curry in the family. The children have a portion with no spice," she said.

"Yours is medium, and I quite like it hot," she said to her husband, Prince William (37), to which she added, "Still, Charlotte is pretty good with heat."

Sources: Express UK, DailyMail
